text: , also called or Yoshitoshi, was a Japanese artist. He was a master of the ukiyo-e style of woodblock prints and painting.Nussbaum, Louis Frédéric. (2005). "Tsukoka Kōgyō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 1000. His adopted son was Tsukoka Kōgyō (1869-1927), who was also an artist. ==Gallery== File:Yoshitoshi - Fukami Jikyû - Tsuki hyakushi no. 55.jpg|From 100 Aspects of the Moon (Tsuki hyakushi), 1885 Image:yoshitoshi 32 aspect.jpg|From 32 Aspects of Women (Fusoku Sanjuniso), 1888 ==References== ==Other websites== * Artencyclopedia.com, Tsukioka Yoshitoshi Online Category:Japanese printmakers Category:1839 births Category:1892 deaths Category:Artists from Tokyo
title: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi
